Posts.Content: May 31, 2012 05:32PM Jennifferm wrote: Hi Karenr1028c, I am doing well. Good days and bad. Trying to do OTC meds during the day and leaving the narcotics for the night. Hopefully my drains will come out tomorrow. I'm getting less than 2cc out every eight hours. Looking forward to that. I got filled to 200 cc on the table but my doctor will wait until the 24th of June before the first fill. I'm hoping to go to a small C, I was a medium D before, but at this point I don't care. Are your TE's really tight and super hard? Also, I'm itching pretty bad where the incisions are. I'm still on antibiotics until Sunday and so far no infection. I also got clean nodes so no ancillary treatment, I just need to heal. My thoughts and prayers are with everyone who has to go through more treatment...I can't imagine.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2012 10:36AM Jennifferm wrote: Thanks flmomandwife for the Bra Idea. I'm going to get one this afternoon. For everyone, I got my drains out today.....what a relief. It did not hurt at all and what a relief! Dr says I'm doing well and I feel 100% better. In fact I'm going out to dinner tonight to celebrate.

Posts.Content: May 12, 2012 11:23AM Jennifferm wrote: I just had an epiphany....I am so stressed out about surgery on the 23rd. And as I've stated before, I've had lots of surgery and do pretty well, but this time I am not "sick". So I'm basically walking into the hospital, "healthy" and then will be sore and in pain for awhile. Always before, I've walked into the hospital, in agony and very Ill so surgery was a must just to feel better. Not sure if that makes sense, but helps explain (to myself) why I have so much anxiety.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: May 5, 2012 03:59AM Jennifferm wrote: I finally had a breakdown list night. I'm schedule for BMX on 5/23 with recon, TE. I have been so busy with work and life that from diagnosis in mid February to now I've just been trying to "keep the wheels on". I spent a few weeks interviewing doctors and more than that on research. I finally made my decision and thought that I was fine. Then, last night when I got home from work, in the mail was a letter from my insurance company. I've been getting approval letters every day for some aspect of the procedure (note here that I am EXTREMLEY pleased with my insurance and thank My husbands employer for providing a truly terrific plan...I am not complaining about insurance). The procdure name always seems a little obscure to me, but this one was horrific, at least to me. It says the procedure is "Trunk Muscle relocation and Skin Graft". I know what this is, as the PS explained it to me, but it seems so barbaric when I look at the words. Needless to say, that during dinner with my husband, I just started crying. Then sobbing. I tried to explain it to him, and he was consolatory but didn't understand my reaction. I'm posting here because I know that you guys "get it". Thanks for letting me vent....patiently waiting for May 23rd.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: May 12, 2012 11:32AM Jennifferm wrote: Hi Fearlessfoot, first sorry you are here with us. I'm always interested to hear about medical programs and techniques around the world. I know people are critical of the U.S. but I wouldn't want to be sick anyplace else in the world. Just my humble opinion. I am hoping and praying for the best for you. Stay strong. As for pictures, I have asked my husband to take goodbye photos of my original breasts too. I have great boobs, again, IMHO and know they will never look like this again, somI think pictures are appropriate for the memories. I am scheduled for BMX on the 23rd. Please keep posted about your progress.

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2012 11:23AM Jennifferm wrote: Hi teeballmom. When I went in to get the dressing off the first time I told the dr I did not want to look. He said then turn towards your husband (away from the mirror). When the bandages dropped and I saw my husbands face he just smiled and said "Jen, you really should look, it's not bad a all". So I turned towards the mirror and like you, teared up but didn't cry. Since then I have looked at them in privacy and am ok. I was a full d cup before, and had not had kids. My original boobs were pretty incredible. My PS said they would never look that way again, so I'm prepared (I think!). I'm going to fill to a small C which is the best the dr thinks we can do and I'm fine with that. I just keep saying No Cancer!!!!! Hang in there.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2012 03:45PM Jennifferm wrote: Cailindearg, I am three weeks out from BMX with TE's today. I started back on core and leg work in Pilates this afternoon. I have been walking a mile or so since day 6. Getting off the narcotics made all the difference. I did that in the first week and now take only Tylenol or Advil as needed. Sleeping is still a huge issue. I'm sleeping propped up, on my back. Can't go to either side yet. So, like everyone has said, sleeping bag? Probabley not, but a trailer or RV, with a comfy bed might work. I have good days, and not so good days. My TE's are tight, and I have so many different bras and they all chaff my skin. My PS makes me wear a bra 24/7 so it is really just uncomfortable, but not pain. Good luck, come back and let us know how you do!
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2012 03:38PM Jennifferm wrote: Soyaandpepper, I am experiencing the same thing with the bras...here's what helps me. I bought about 10 different kinds and types of sports bras. Nothing expensive, Walmart, target and cobbies. As soon as one starts bothering my skin, I change it out to a completely different type. This has saved me. Right now I have one on that is rather high around the chest...I've had it on for about 5 hours and am about to change to one that is a little bigger and lower in the front. Until I started doing this, I thought the skin chaffing was going to be the end of me! I had a catheter too. Only know because they told me after the surgery.
